004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
008
009/**
010 * Class implements a PID Control Loop.
011 *
012 * <p>Creates a separate thread which reads the given PIDSource and takes care of the integral
013 * calculations, as well as writing the given PIDOutput.
014 *
015 * <p>This feedback controller runs in discrete time, so time deltas are not used in the integral
016 * and derivative calculations. Therefore, the sample rate affects the controller's behavior for a
017 * given set of PID constants.
018 *
019 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
020 *
021 * @deprecated Use {@link edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController} instead.
022 */
023@Deprecated(since = "2020", forRemoval = true)
024public class PIDController extends PIDBase implements Controller {
025  Notifier m_controlLoop = new Notifier(this::calculate);
026
027  /**
028   * Allocate a PID object with the given constants for P, I, D, and F.
029   *
030   * @param Kp the proportional coefficient
031   * @param Ki the integral coefficient
032   * @param Kd the derivative coefficient
033   * @param Kf the feed forward term
034   * @param source The PIDSource object that is used to get values
035   * @param output The PIDOutput object that is set to the output percentage
036   * @param period the loop time for doing calculations in seconds. This particularly affects
037   *     calculations of the integral and differential terms. The default is 0.05 (50ms).
038   */
039  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
040  public PIDController(
041      double Kp,
042      double Ki,
043      double Kd,
044      double Kf,
045      PIDSource source,
046      PIDOutput output,
047      double period) {
048    super(Kp, Ki, Kd, Kf, source, output);
049    m_controlLoop.startPeriodic(period);
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Allocate a PID object with the given constants for P, I, D and period.
054   *
055   * @param Kp the proportional coefficient
056   * @param Ki the integral coefficient
057   * @param Kd the derivative coefficient
058   * @param source the PIDSource object that is used to get values
059   * @param output the PIDOutput object that is set to the output percentage
060   * @param period the loop time for doing calculations in seconds. This particularly affects
061   *     calculations of the integral and differential terms. The default is 0.05 (50ms).
062   */
063  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
064  public PIDController(
065      double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, PIDSource source, PIDOutput output, double period) {
066    this(Kp, Ki, Kd, 0.0, source, output, period);
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Allocate a PID object with the given constants for P, I, D, using a 50ms period.
071   *
072   * @param Kp the proportional coefficient
073   * @param Ki the integral coefficient
074   * @param Kd the derivative coefficient
075   * @param source The PIDSource object that is used to get values
076   * @param output The PIDOutput object that is set to the output percentage
077   */
078  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
079  public PIDController(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, PIDSource source, PIDOutput output) {
080    this(Kp, Ki, Kd, source, output, kDefaultPeriod);
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Allocate a PID object with the given constants for P, I, D, using a 50ms period.
085   *
086   * @param Kp the proportional coefficient
087   * @param Ki the integral coefficient
088   * @param Kd the derivative coefficient
089   * @param Kf the feed forward term
090   * @param source The PIDSource object that is used to get values
091   * @param output The PIDOutput object that is set to the output percentage
092   */
093  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
094  public PIDController(
095      double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, double Kf, PIDSource source, PIDOutput output) {
096    this(Kp, Ki, Kd, Kf, source, output, kDefaultPeriod);
097  }
098
099  @Override
100  public void close() {
101    m_controlLoop.close();
102    m_thisMutex.lock();
103    try {
104      m_pidOutput = null;
105      m_pidInput = null;
106      m_controlLoop = null;
107    } finally {
108      m_thisMutex.unlock();
109    }
110  }
111
112  /** Begin running the PIDController. */
113  @Override
114  public void enable() {
115    m_thisMutex.lock();
116    try {
117      m_enabled = true;
118    } finally {
119      m_thisMutex.unlock();
120    }
121  }
122
123  /** Stop running the PIDController, this sets the output to zero before stopping. */
124  @Override
125  public void disable() {
126    // Ensures m_enabled check and pidWrite() call occur atomically
127    m_pidWriteMutex.lock();
128    try {
129      m_thisMutex.lock();
130      try {
131        m_enabled = false;
132      } finally {
133        m_thisMutex.unlock();
134      }
135
136      m_pidOutput.pidWrite(0);
137    } finally {
138      m_pidWriteMutex.unlock();
139    }
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Set the enabled state of the PIDController.
144   *
145   * @param enable True to enable the PIDController.
146   */
147  public void setEnabled(boolean enable) {
148    if (enable) {
149      enable();
150    } else {
151      disable();
152    }
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Return true if PIDController is enabled.
157   *
158   * @return True if PIDController is enabled.
159   */
160  public boolean isEnabled() {
161    m_thisMutex.lock();
162    try {
163      return m_enabled;
164    } finally {
165      m_thisMutex.unlock();
166    }
167  }
168
169  /** Reset the previous error, the integral term, and disable the controller. */
170  @Override
171  public void reset() {
172    disable();
173
174    super.reset();
175  }
176
177  @Override
178  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
179    super.initSendable(builder);
180    builder.addBooleanProperty("enabled", this::isEnabled, this::setEnabled);
181  }
182}
